availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Ingram (Wayne County, Kentucky, trader and farmer)

body.p: Wayne County, Kentucky, trader and farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Nancy Ingram. Trader in Wayne County in 1860. Household owned thirteen enslaved persons in Wayne County in 1860. Farmer in Wayne County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, p. 249.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, District 1, p. 19B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, p. 475A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Wayne County, KY, July 1863, p. 83 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "John Borlen Ingram (1829-1887)," Memorial #73317513, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/73317513 (accessed June 15, 2020).
